title: Short-Term Mathematics Problem-Solving Strategy Design Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic arithmetic operations and fundamental algebraic concepts
context.additional_context: Blended Environment Combining Smartphone-Based Mobile Learning with Offline Workshops, Providing Personalized Problem-Solving Strategies Based on Individual Cognitive Load Measurements

learning_goals: Learners can accurately distinguish and explain three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, and germane).
Learners can measure and record their cognitive load levels during mathematical problem-solving using a 5-level questionnaire.
Learners can achieve over 80% accuracy rates by selecting problem representations that minimize extraneous cognitive load.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
